title: Eumetazoa
summary: Eumetazoa (Greek: εὖ [eu], well + μετά [metá], after + ζῷον [zóon], animal), also known as Diploblasts, Epitheliozoa, or Histozoa, are a proposed basal animal clade as a sister group of the Porifera.[5][6][7][8][9] The basal Eumetazoan clades are the Ctenophora and the ParaHoxozoa. Placozoa is now also seen as an Eumetazoan in the ParaHoxozoa.
